The last time I took DHC or Xanax was the Sunday of Labor Day.
I was on a large benzo/opiate habit and got off both 3 weeks to the day. The withdrawal was really intense
A week ago, I was terrified to give up the pills. The oxy and benzos ruled my every waking moment. I still haven't had the withdrawals I was expecting
So, ya obvs 26 days clean. Still having restless legs, but my regular Dr says they're not related, which means that the only withdrawal symptom I had was insomnia
I am starting to really mourn for ten years I lost to oxycontin and Xanax. I wonder what my life would be like now if I would never have taken that first pill
I was very upfront about​ my recovery
Not this year. I celebrated by not using. It was hard, so hard to actually deal with all that pain, and all of those emotions, but I made it. By the grace of God, I didn't use.

Six months and some change ago I couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something to change the way I feel

a year ago I was in a hospital bed
I’m officially one year clean from opiates
It's day 3 off of a 8 day relapse
Dropping the Lope to 6mg today, plan on dropping the Benzo to .25mg today and .75mg tonight before bed
Physically, most of everything has passed. I'm just in one of those dull moments where I'm struggling to find some joy and feelings outside of sadness.
One week down, working on day 8
Eight days down, moving into day 9
I'm wrapping up day 11 in a few hours and figured I'd spew some shit out about progress that might help someone.
It's been a long work week, still have a full day today and tomorrow. ... I have taken care of a lot of bullshit I've been putting off for months over the last 12 days
Coming up on two weeks later today. I feel like I can remember every second that's passed by.

This past weekend was better than the last. Got a lot of exercise in, bunch of stuff done around the house, went to an early dinner with my wife, cooked for the week and just hung out with some friends.
16 days in the books... Slept a straight 7 hours last night. Two morning GI episodes. Only really annoying thing left from the physical side is clammy hands, feet, pits.
I can say that I have never had a craving in the 17 days up until that point.
Yesterday was okay minus a crazy afternoon episode of the sweats. I fuckin hate that feeling. ... Lingering symptoms are still morning GI/Restless when I try to relax/anxiety sweats
Symptoms at 3 weeks out... broken sleep of 4-6 hours, morning shits (a very zen one this morning at least), anhedonia waves, come and go restless limbs.
this is officially the longest clean streak in a year of my 2 year run with opiates
Only things lingering around at 25 days are morning GI, restless sleep, anxiety/anhedonia waves. I think it's gradually getting better but it feels sort of consistent over the last few days.
This was the day of the month I would get my script refilled and normally start the process of one GREAT week followed by the cycle of withdrawal etc etc
My body/brain are feeling anxious, depressed and just out of sync compared to 27-30. Almost feels like days 7-11 again.
I've gone this long. I feel so much better than I thought I would. being off dope feels so good
I haven't been using for almost two months
I haven't thought that in so long time even when I made it to three days before
I was so fucked up on dope and xanax and kpins that i blacked out the entire way. ... Im still only a few days clean, but im not turning back.
This is the longest I've been sober in a year at least

I had planned to document daily, but I've left that idea behind. ... I'm so grateful to this sub for being my go-to everyday, reminding me what day one is like, and encouraging me that there can be a year 3, 4 and more.
I've got 4 months clean and sober
I kicked a 4 year IV meth habit. I went from being a junkie to being a contributing member of society, with a great family and career.
I was able to put together a year, which turned into a year and a half (where I am currently), and now I am truly beginning to realize that there is a major difference in my thought process overall.
I remember when I was using

I figured it was time to stop. Lope definitely helped my withdrawals the first three days and then when I woke up on the 4th day, I felt completely fine.
My withdrawals are never really that bad besides the sleep problem but I just take two extremely high doses of loperamide each 48 hours apart and before I know it i'm clear of the withdrawals
